page.title:
EDR System Features What is an EDR System?
EDR System Features
What is an EDR System?
page.enlisting:
• Purpose is to improve timeliness and quality of death • Enables participants of death registration to register death certificates with local and state registrars electronically • Provides for online access so decedent fact of death, cause of death, and demographic information can be entered by multiple death registration participants working on same case 06/22/2004 • Purpose is to improve timeliness and quality of death
• Purpose is to improve timeliness and quality of death
• Enables participants of death registration to register death certificates with local and state registrars electronically • Provides for online access so decedent fact of death, cause of death, and demographic information can be entered by multiple death registration participants working on same case 06/22/2004 • Enables participants of death registration to register death certificates with local and state registrars electronically
• Enables participants of death registration to register death
certificates with local and state registrars electronically
• Provides for online access so decedent fact of death, cause of death, and demographic information can be entered by multiple death registration participants working on same case

page.title:
EDR System Features Why the Need for an EDR System?
EDR System Features
Why the Need for an EDR System?
page.enlisting:
• Final act of care done by a physician for an
• Final act of care done by a physician for an individual is to ensure that their death certificate is accurate, complete, and filed in a timely manner so the family can bring closure to the business matters of the deceased

page.title:
EDR System Features Why the Need for an EDR System?
EDR System Features
Why the Need for an EDR System?
page.enlisting:
• Multiple participants involved – Funeral directors – Physicians – Coroners, Medical Examiners – Institutions, such as hospitals, nursing homes – State, and possibly local registrars • Current manual process is time consuming – Handwritten signatures required – Death certificate passed between participants via mail or is – Registration can be delayed due to incorrect information or • Multiple participants involved
• Multiple participants involved
– Funeral directors – Physicians – Coroners, Medical Examiners – Institutions, such as hospitals, nursing homes – State, and possibly local registrars

– State, and possibly local registrars
